attributes.title: Instant Udon Annotation
attributes.description: The product that I chose was a instant udon (http://ec2.images-amazon.com/images/I/61-DWQVnJ8L._SL500_AA300_.jpg) from the company, Itsuki foods (http://www.itsukifoods.jp/index.html). Itsuki foods was established in 1878. The headquarter is in Kumamoto city, Kumamoto prefecture, Japan, and they have 5 branch stores. Itsuki foods's products are sold at many supermarkets in Japan, and even are exporting their products to other countries, such as China, Korea, Southeast Asia, America, Australia, and Europe. The products Itsuki foods sell are all noodles.

Soybeans are used to make the topping, deep-fried tofu. The soybeans are sent to the factory in Kumamoto, then is made into a thin layer of tofu, and fried afterwards. After getting fried, the moisture is taken out of it, and is assembled with the other ingredients.
attributes.title: Soybeans

attributes.description: The plastic is used to wrap the whole product. The plastic is sent from Gifu prefecture in Japan, to the factory in Kumamoto prefecture.
attributes.title: Plastic

attributes.description: The bonito extract is similar to the seasoning and is  used to flavor the soup, but is in a different piece of plastic. This bonito extract is made and packaged in Ishikawa, Japan.
attributes.title: Bonito extract

attributes.description: Flour is sent from Australia to the factory in Japan, and is used to make the udon/noodles.
attributes.title: Flour

attributes.description: All the ingredients are sent to the factory in Kumamoto prefecture, then put together, and finally packaged to be sent to stores.
attributes.title: Factory (assembling and packaging)

attributes.description: Paper is used as the front cover or the designed bit of this product. The paper has a picture of the noodles, the name of the product, the ingredients, directions for making the noodles, and more information. This paper is from Fukuoka prefecture.
attributes.title: Paper

attributes.description: The factory of the Itsuki Foods is also in Kumamoto city, Kumamoto prefecture.
attributes.title: Itsuki Foods Headquarters

attributes.description: Same exact description as the other "Seasoning" point.
attributes.title: Seasoning (soy sauce powder)

attributes.description: Soy sauce powder for this product comes from Korea and Thailand. The soy sauce powder is used to flavor the soup. In the factories of Korea and Thailand, the soy sauce powder (soybeans from America in use) is created, then put into a small piece of plastic, and gets exported to Japan.
attributes.title: Seasoning powder (soy sauce powder)

attributes.description: The seaweed is harvested in the ocean of Tokushima prefecture in Japan. Then the seaweed is dried out at a factory in Naruto city, Tokushima prefecture.
attributes.title: Seaweed

attributes.description: Shrimps are used as the topping of the udon. The shrimps are harvested in the ocean of China, then the moisture in the shrimps are completely taken out at a factory in Fangchenggang China.
attributes.title: Shrimp

attributes.description: Aluminum is used as the container for this product. The Aluminum is created in Shizuoka city, Shizuoka prefecture, then sent to the main factory in Kumamoto.
attributes.title: Aluminum
Seasoning powder (soy sauce powder)  to Factory (assembling)
